H0.text: The depth of the lake is the property scientists can measure to understand the amount of energy held by the pond water.

H1.text: The color of the water is the property that scientists studying a pond can measure to understand the amount of energy held by the lake water.

H2.text: The volume of the lake is the property that scientists can measure to understand the amount of energy held by the lake water.

H3.text: The temperature of the water is the property that scientists can measure to understand the amount of energy held by the pond.

A4.text: Temperature reflects the average kinetic energy of the vibrating and colliding atoms making up a substance.

A5.text: Temperature is measured with a thermometer.
